result.execSummary:
The defendant Grace J Rutkowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders outright: 6 months drivers license suspension

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge

--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription; take only prescriptions that are prescribed by a medical professional and only in doses prescribed

--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes or as approved by agent

--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to be subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening at the discretion of the agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to submit DNA sample upon demand to designee/Sheriff

Arresting Agency:  Palmyra PD

The Court advises Ms. Rutkowski that she can have DNA sample expunged

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--With work-release privileges

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

--The Court authorizes sentence to be transferred to Milwaukee Co. so long as it is served without electric monitoring or GPS monitoring.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Grace J Rutkowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: With JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 2:10pm [mo}
Defendant Grace J Rutkowski in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Svehlek
--The Court reviews letter submitted by Atty. Svehlek on behalf of ROOTS counseling service

Statement made by Ms. Rutkowski's father
Statement made by ROOTS house manager, Mr. Doro. 
---The Court discloses that it knows the parents of Mr.Doro, socially, the Court does not feel it needs to recuse itself for this reason. 
---Counsel agrees that recusal is not needed

Statement made by Ms. Rutkowski

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on September 3, 2015 at 5:00pm.
--The Court authorizes sentence to be transferred to Milwaukee Co. so long as it is served without electric monitoring or GPS monitoring.
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to be subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening at the discretion of the agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription; take only prescriptions that are prescribed by a medical professional and only in doses prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes or as approved by agent 
--to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to submit DNA sample upon demand to designee/Sheriff

The Court orders outright: 6 months drivers license suspension

The Court advises Ms. Rutkowski that she can have DNA sample expunged
The Court informs parties that if a further stay in Ms. Rutkowski's conditional jail time is needed it would accept a motion on this issue.

Days credit for time already served:  1  day
Felony Firearm/Voting prohibition given
recess: 2:56pm
Letter and treatment reports submitted by Attorney Svehlek
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 29, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Case called at 9:00am [mo]
Defendant Grace J Rutkowski in court with Attorney Yelena Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Ms.  Rutowski waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on all counts 

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.


NEXT:  PLEA & SENTENCING: MAY 29, 2015 AT 1:45PM
Status conference on April 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 1:15 pm Clerk SJM
Defendant Grace Rutkowski in court with Attorney Zarwell Jefferson County Public Defenders office. PD will appoint counsel. Defendant Grace Rutkowski in custody. Public Service Special Prosecutor Atty Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin

Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, with conditions:

-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 


NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
 (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 03-04-2015 10:00am- Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 3-24-2015 at 8:30 am - Send notices
